question:
The World Vision Report of WHO reported the presence of gender disparity in incidence of cataract. In this context, consider the following statements about this condition:
  1. Age is the most common cause of cataract.
  2. Cataract is the most common cause of blindness in India.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Cataract is a visual impairment caused by increased opacity of the eye lens. The most common cause of cataract is ageing. The WHO report shows that more women than men are affected by cataract. This is especially visible in the middle and low income countries. Statement 2 is correct: Cataract is the most common cause of blindness in India. Over 62% of blindness cases in India is because of cataract. The National Program for Control of Blindness performed cataract surgeries on over 6 million people in 2016-17 according to the WHO report.
